general.description: MotoGP is the premier class of motorcycle road racing, organized by the Fédération Internationale de Motocyclisme (FIM). It features high-speed, multi-manufacturer racing on circuits worldwide.

origins.first_race: The inaugural MotoGP World Championship race was held in 1949 as part of the Isle of Man TT.
origins.early_era: Initially featured classes based on engine size, including 50cc, 125cc, 250cc, and 500cc.

milestones.event: Introduction of the MotoGP class, replacing the 500cc category with 990cc four-stroke engines.
Reduction of engine capacity to 800cc to enhance safety.
Return to 1000cc engines for the MotoGP class.
Introduction of MotoE, an electric motorcycle racing series.

general.description: MotoGP motorcycles are high-performance, purpose-built racing machines that are not available for public sale, designed for maximum speed, agility, and cornering performance.
general.fuel: Unleaded racing fuel with specific FIM regulations

features: Winglets to improve stability and reduce wheelies
Underslung exhaust systems for improved weight distribution

types: Soft (for maximum grip at the cost of durability)
Hard (for durability in hot conditions or abrasive surfaces)

technology.launch_control: Assists riders in achieving optimal starts
technology.quick_shifter: Enables seamless gear changes without using the clutch
technology.ride_height_devices: Adjusts the motorcycle's height dynamically for better performance
